intro: Neostenanthera hamata, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed sandarac, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. Neostenanthera hamata is typically found in moist, tropical forest environments.
